intro: Ortholoma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in chaparral habitats. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Ortholoma parviflorum is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
